content.description:
sit-start. start on arete with your left hand in a huge chalky jug that is just to the left of arete, right hand on right side of arete either on the horizontal or pinching the cool thumb catch hold. go up and to the right on thin but positive crimpers. top out on crimp dishes and jugs.

you can find the description also in the "utah bouldering guide". it's a little vague but I assume this is the correct line. if anyone disagrees please help correct the info.
content.location: stand looking north at the sweet boulder. immediately to your right is a short boulder. the arete that points SW is this problem.

content.description: Sit start with right hand in a pocket on a horizontal break at face height.   Move up and left to undercling and then a large span straight out to the lip.  Top it out by going straight up.
content.location: The second route from the right on the Dyno Boulder.

content.description: "Sit down. Grab the small edges and throw to the sloper. Height dependent. Jeff Baldwin tried it 90 times, Steven Jeffrey flashed it." Black Bible
content.location: Furthest problem on the right of Dyno Boulder.

content.description: start low and right on the west face of the dyno boulder, move left on awkward holds, then up to big sloper and a strange top out.
content.protection: a pad or two.  there is one small block right in the landing zone.
content.location: on the west face of the 'dyno boulder'
